TITLE: Creating Giscus React Component with Theme Support DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript React component (Comments.tsx) wraps the Giscus component and adds support for light and dark themes, syncing with the site's theme. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-integrate-giscus-comments.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import Giscus, { type Theme } from "@giscus/react"; import { GISCUS } from "@/constants"; import { useEffect, useState } from "react"; interface CommentsProps { lightTheme?: Theme; darkTheme?: Theme; } export default function Comments({ lightTheme = "light", darkTheme = "dark", }: CommentsProps) { const [theme, setTheme] = useState(() => { const currentTheme = localStorage.getItem("theme"); const browserTheme = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)") .matches ? "dark" : "light"; return currentTheme || browserTheme; }); useEffect(() => { const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)"); const handleChange = ({ matches }: MediaQueryListEvent) => { setTheme(matches ? "dark" : "light"); }; mediaQuery.addEventListener("change", handleChange); return () => mediaQuery.removeEventListener("change", handleChange); }, []); useEffect(() => { const themeButton = document.querySelector("#theme-btn"); const handleClick = () => { setTheme(prevTheme => (prevTheme === "dark" ? "light" : "dark")); }; themeButton?.addEventListener("click", handleClick); return () => themeButton?.removeEventListener("click", handleClick); }, []); return (
); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Frontmatter for AstroPaper Blog Post (YAML) DESCRIPTION: Example of a complete frontmatter section for a blog post in the AstroPaper theme, including all available properties and their usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/adding-new-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` # src/content/blog/sample-post.md --- title: The title of the post author: your name pubDatetime: 2022-09-21T05:17:19Z slug: the-title-of-the-post featured: true draft: false tags: - some - example - tags ogImage: ../../assets/images/example.png # src/assets/images/example.png # ogImage: "https://example.org/remote-image.png" # remote URL description: This is the example description of the example post. canonicalURL: https://example.org/my-article-was-already-posted-here --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SITE Object in AstroPaper Theme - JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Configuration object that controls the main settings of the AstroPaper blog theme. Includes settings for website metadata, author information, display preferences, pagination, and feature toggles. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-configure-astropaper-theme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export const SITE = { website: "https://astro-paper.pages.dev/", // replace this with your deployed domain author: "Sat Naing", profile: "https://satnaing.dev/", desc: "A minimal, responsive and SEO-friendly Astro blog theme.", title: "AstroPaper", ogImage: "astropaper-og.jpg", lightAndDarkMode: true, postPerIndex: 4, postPerPage: 4, scheduledPostMargin: 15 * 60 * 1000, // 15 minutes showArchives: true, showBackButton: true, // show back button in post detail editPost: { enabled: true, text: "Suggest Changes", url: "https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper/edit/main/", }, dynamicOgImage: true, // enable automatic dynamic og-image generation lang: "en", // html lang code. Set this empty and default will be "en" timezone: "Asia/Bangkok", // Default global timezone (IANA format) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones } as const; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying AstroPaper Project Structure DESCRIPTION: Shows the folder and file structure of the AstroPaper project, including public assets, source files, and configuration files. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` / ├── public/ │ ├── assets/ | ├── pagefind/ # auto-generated when build │ └── favicon.svg │ └── astropaper-og.jpg │ └── favicon.svg │ └── toggle-theme.js ├── src/ │ ├── assets/ │ │ └── icons/ │ │ └── images/ │ ├── components/ │ ├── data/ │ │ └── blog/ │ │ └── some-blog-posts.md │ ├── layouts/ │ └── pages/ │ └── styles/ │ └── utils/ │ └── config.ts │ └── constants.ts │ └── content.config.ts └── astro.config.ts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Image Logo in Astro Header DESCRIPTION: HTML code for replacing the site title with an imported image in the site header. The example includes CSS for inverting the image in dark mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-configure-astropaper-theme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparing Old and New Content Fetching Methods in AstroPaper 2.0 DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the transition from the old content fetching method using import.meta.glob to the new method using getCollection from Astro's Content Collections API. The new approach simplifies the process by eliminating the need to specify relative paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/_releases/astro-paper-2.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // old content fetching method - const postImportResult = import.meta.glob>( "../contents/**/**/*.md",); // new content fetching method + const postImportResult = await getCollection("blog"); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Custom Color Scheme for AstroPaper DESCRIPTION: An example CSS snippet showing how to create a custom 'lobster' color scheme for the light mode by modifying the root CSS variables in the theme's base.css file. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/customizing-astropaper-theme-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` @layer base { /* lobster color scheme */ :root, html[data-theme="light"] { --color-fill: 246, 238, 225; --color-text-base: 1, 44, 86; --color-accent: 225, 74, 57; --color-card: 220, 152, 145; --color-card-muted: 233, 119, 106; --color-border: 220, 152, 145; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Astro to Use LaTeX Plugins DESCRIPTION: TypeScript configuration for astro.config.ts that adds the remark-math and rehype-katex plugins to Astro's markdown processing pipeline. This setup enables LaTeX equation rendering throughout the site. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-add-latex-equations-in-blog-posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // other imports import remarkMath from "remark-math"; import rehypeKatex from "rehype-katex"; export default defineConfig({ // other configs markdown: { remarkPlugins: [ remarkMath, // <- new plugin remarkToc, [remarkCollapse, { test: "Table of contents" }], ], rehypePlugins: [rehypeKatex], // <- new plugin shikiConfig: { // For more themes, visit https://shiki.style/themes themes: { light: "min-light", dark: "night-owl" }, wrap: true, }, }, // other configs }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Default Tags in AstroPaper (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: TypeScript code snippet for setting the default tag in the AstroPaper theme's content configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/adding-new-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // src/content/config.ts export const blogSchema = z.object({ // --- draft: z.boolean().optional(), tags: z.array(z.string()).default(["others"]), // replace "others" with whatever you want // --- }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Blog Post Frontmatter with Astro Content Slug in AstroPaper v4 DESCRIPTION: Example of the new blog post frontmatter format in AstroPaper v4, showing how to use the Astro Content 'slug' field instead of the previous 'postSlug'. If slug is not specified, the file name will be used as the slug. Note that the slug field cannot be an empty string. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/_releases/astro-paper-4.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` --- author: Sat Naing pubDatetime: 2024-01-01T04:35:33.428Z title: AstroPaper 4.0 slug: "astro-paper-v4" # if slug is not specified, it will be 'astro-paper-4' (file name). # slug: "" ❌ cannot be an empty string --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Giscus Configuration in constants.ts DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript snippet defines the GISCUS configuration object in the constants.ts file, which is used by the Comments component. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-integrate-giscus-comments.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ts CODE: ``` import type { GiscusProps } from "@giscus/react"; ... export const GISCUS: GiscusProps = { repo: "[ENTER REPO HERE]", repoId: "[ENTER REPO ID HERE]", category: "[ENTER CATEGORY NAME HERE]", categoryId: "[ENTER CATEGORY ID HERE]", mapping: "pathname", reactionsEnabled: "0", emitMetadata: "0", inputPosition: "bottom", lang: "en", loading: "lazy", }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Organizing Blog Posts in Subdirectories (Bash) DESCRIPTION: Examples of file structure and corresponding URLs for blog posts in the AstroPaper theme, demonstrating subdirectory organization and URL generation. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/adding-new-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Example: blog post structure and URLs src/data/blog/very-first-post.md -> mysite.com/posts/very-first-post src/data/blog/2025/example-post.md -> mysite.com/posts/2025/example-post src/data/blog/_2026/another-post.md -> mysite.com/posts/another-post src/data/blog/docs/_legacy/how-to.md -> mysite.com/docs/how-to src/data/blog/Example Dir/Dummy Post.md -> mysite.com/example-dir/dummy-post ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Comments Component to PostDetails.astro DESCRIPTION: This diff snippet shows how to import and add the Comments component to the PostDetails.astro file, replacing the previous script tag approach. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-integrate-giscus-comments.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` + import Comments from "@/components/Comments"; +
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Required Packages for LaTeX Support in Astro DESCRIPTION: Command to install the necessary remark and rehype plugins for LaTeX rendering in an Astro blog. This installs rehype-katex for rendering LaTeX equations, remark-math for parsing math content, and katex as the core LaTeX engine. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-add-latex-equations-in-blog-posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm install rehype-katex remark-math katex ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Color Schemes in AstroPaper Theme DESCRIPTION: CSS code demonstrating how to modify the color palette for both light and dark modes by changing CSS custom properties in the base.css file. Each color property controls different visual elements of the theme. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/customizing-astropaper-theme-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* file: src/styles/base.css */ @tailwind base; @tailwind components; @tailwind utilities; @layer base { :root, html[data-theme="light"] { --color-fill: 251, 254, 251; --color-text-base: 40, 39, 40; --color-accent: 0, 108, 172; --color-card: 230, 230, 230; --color-card-muted: 205, 205, 205; --color-border: 236, 233, 233; } html[data-theme="dark"] { --color-fill: 47, 55, 65; --color-text-base: 230, 230, 230; --color-accent: 26, 217, 217; --color-card: 63, 75, 90; --color-card-muted: 89, 107, 129; --color-border: 59, 70, 85; } /* other styles */ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Color Palette in CSS for Light and Dark Themes DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet defines the color palette for both light and dark themes in AstroPaper v5. It uses CSS variables to set colors for background, foreground, accent, muted, and border elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/_releases/astro-paper-5.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` :root, html[data-theme="light"] { --background: #fdfdfd; --foreground: #282728; --accent: #006cac; --muted: #e6e6e6; --border: #ece9e9; } html[data-theme="dark"] { --background: #212737; --foreground: #eaedf3; --accent: #ff6b01; --muted: #343f60bf; --border: #ab4b08; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating modDatetime for Modified Files in Shell DESCRIPTION: This shell script updates the modDatetime in the frontmatter of modified Markdown files. It checks the draft status and updates accordingly, handling first releases and published posts differently. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/setting-dates-via-git-hooks.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # Modified files, update the modDatetime git diff --cached --name-status | grep -i '^M.*\.md$' | while read _ file; do filecontent=$(cat "$file") frontmatter=$(echo "$filecontent" | awk -v RS='---' 'NR==2{print}') draft=$(echo "$frontmatter" | awk '/^draft: /{print $2}') if [ "$draft" = "false" ]; then echo "$file modDateTime updated" cat $file | sed "/---.*/,/---.*/s/^modDatetime:.*$/modDatetime: $(date -u "+%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")/" > tmp mv tmp $file git add $file fi if [ "$draft" = "first" ]; then echo "First release of $file, draft set to false and modDateTime removed" cat $file | sed "/---.*/,/---.*/s/^modDatetime:.*$/modDatetime:/" | sed "/---.*/,/---.*/s/^draft:.*$/draft: false/" > tmp mv tmp $file git add $file fi done ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Draft Post Frontmatter in Astro/YAML DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter configuration for an Astro blog post marked as draft. Includes metadata like title, author, publication datetime, slug, featured status, draft status, tags and description. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/examples/example-draft-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- title: Example Draft Post author: Sat Naing pubDatetime: 2022-06-06T04:06:31Z slug: example-draft-post featured: false draft: true tags: - TypeScript - Astro description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Praesent elementum facilisis leo vel fringilla est --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding pubDatetime for New Files in Shell DESCRIPTION: This shell script adds or updates the pubDatetime in the frontmatter of newly added Markdown files. It uses git diff to identify new files and sed to update the frontmatter. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/setting-dates-via-git-hooks.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # New files, add/update the pubDatetime git diff --cached --name-status | egrep -i "^(A).*\.(md)$" | while read a b; do cat $b | sed "/---.*/,/---.*/s/^pubDatetime:.*$/pubDatetime: $(date -u "+%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")/" > tmp mv tmp $b git add $b done ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing AstroPaper Using Package Managers DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing AstroPaper using different package managers including pnpm, npm, and yarn. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # pnpm pnpm create astro@latest --template satnaing/astro-paper # npm npm create astro@latest -- --template satnaing/astro-paper # yarn yarn create astro --template satnaing/astro-paper ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Images in AstroPaper Blog Posts (Markdown) DESCRIPTION: Markdown examples demonstrating correct and incorrect ways to display images in AstroPaper blog posts, including relative and alias paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/adding-new-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![something](@/assets/images/example.jpg) ![something](../../assets/images/example.jpg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Lobster Light Theme in CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS code for the Lobster light color scheme with a warm beige background and deep blue foreground. This scheme uses a reddish accent color with muted gold and salmon pink for highlights and borders. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/predefined-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` :root, html[data-theme="light"] { --background: #f6eee1; --foreground: #012c56; --accent: #e14a39; --muted: #efd8b0; --border: #dc9891; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Table of Contents in AstroPaper Blog Post (Markdown) DESCRIPTION: Markdown example showing how to properly include a table of contents in an AstroPaper blog post. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/adding-new-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- # some frontmatter --- Here are some recommendations, tips & ticks for creating new posts in AstroPaper blog theme. ## Table of contents ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Pinky Light Theme in CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS code for the Pinky light color scheme with a clean white background and dark blue-gray foreground. This scheme uses a magenta accent color with soft pink tones for muted areas and borders. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/predefined-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` :root, html[data-theme="light"] { --background: #fafcfc; --foreground: #222e36; --accent: #d3006a; --muted: #f1bad4; --border: #e3a9c6; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Components and Utilities in Astro DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the updated import syntax in AstroPaper v5, where the import alias has been changed from '@directory' to '@/directory'. It shows how to import a utility function and an SVG icon component. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/_releases/astro-paper-5.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: astro CODE: ``` --- import { slugifyStr } from "@/utils/slugify"; import IconHash from "@/assets/icons/IconHash.svg"; --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Deep Oyster Dark Theme in CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS code for the Deep Oyster dark theme with a deep blue-purple background and off-white foreground. This theme uses a bright red accent color with muted blue-purple and dark red for highlights and borders. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/predefined-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` html[data-theme="dark"] { --background: #21233d; --foreground: #f4f7f5; --accent: #ff5256; --muted: #4a4e86; --border: #b12f32; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding LaTeX Text Color in Tailwind CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS styling for KaTeX elements to ensure they match the site's theme. This snippet adds a text-foreground class to KaTeX display elements through Tailwind's typography plugin, ensuring equations are visible in both light and dark modes. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-add-latex-equations-in-blog-posts.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` @plugin '@tailwindcss/typography'; @layer base { /* other classes */ /* Katex text color */ .prose .katex-display { @apply text-foreground; } /* ===== Code Blocks & Syntax Highlighting ===== */ /* other classes */ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Pikky Dark Theme in CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS code for the Pikky dark theme with a dark gray-blue background and light gray foreground. This theme uses a bright pink accent color with muted purple and purple-brown for highlights and borders. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/predefined-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` html[data-theme="dark"] { --background: #353640; --foreground: #e9edf1; --accent: #ff78c8; --muted: #715566; --border: #86436b; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Images in Markdown and HTML DESCRIPTION: Examples showing how to reference and display images stored in the public directory using both Markdown syntax and HTML img tags. The examples assume an image 'example.jpg' located at '/public/assets/images/example.jpg'. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/adding-new-post.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![something](/assets/images/example.jpg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing AstroPaper v4 Special Dark Theme in CSS DESCRIPTION: CSS code for the AstroPaper v4 special dark theme featuring a deep blue-black background with blue accent. This theme uses a very dark blue background with light gray foreground and blue color scheme for accent, muted, and border elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/predefined-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` html[data-theme="dark"] { --background: #000123; --accent: #617bff; --foreground: #eaedf3; --muted: #0c0e4f; --border: #303f8a; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running AstroPaper Locally DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing dependencies and starting the development server. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # install dependencies if you haven't done so in the previous step. pnpm install # start running the project pnpm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Social Links in TypeScript Constants DESCRIPTION: TypeScript code showing how to configure social media links in the constants.ts file. Each social link includes name, href, linkTitle, and icon properties. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-configure-astropaper-theme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export const SOCIALS = [ { name: "Github", href: "https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper", linkTitle: ` ${SITE.title} on Github`, icon: IconGitHub, }, { name: "X", href: "https://x.com/username", linkTitle: `${SITE.title} on X`, icon: IconBrandX, }, { name: "LinkedIn", href: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/username/", linkTitle: `${SITE.title} on LinkedIn`, icon: IconLinkedin, }, { name: "Mail", href: "mailto:yourmail@gmail.com", linkTitle: `Send an email to ${SITE.title}`, icon: IconMail, }, ] as const; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing SVG Logo Component in Astro Header DESCRIPTION: Code for importing an SVG logo into the Header.astro component. This allows for replacing the site title with a custom SVG logo. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-configure-astropaper-theme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: astro CODE: ``` --- // other imports import DummyLogo from "@/assets/dummy-logo.svg"; --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing SVG Logo in Astro Header DESCRIPTION: HTML code for replacing the site title with an imported SVG logo component in the site header. The example includes CSS for scaling and inverting the logo in dark mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/how-to-configure-astropaper-theme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying AstroPaper Config for Nullable modDatetime in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript code snippet modifies the AstroPaper configuration to allow the modDatetime field to be nullable. It adds the .nullable() function to the schema definition. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/setting-dates-via-git-hooks.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const blog = defineCollection({ type: "content", schema: ({ image }) => z.object({ author: z.string().default(SITE.author), pubDatetime: z.date(), - modDatetime: z.date().optional(), + modDatetime: z.date().optional().nullable(), title: z.string(), featured: z.boolean().optional(), draft: z.boolean().optional(), tags: z.array(z.string()).default(["others"]), ogImage: image().or(z.string()).optional(), description: z.string(), canonicalURL: z.string().optional(), readingTime: z.string().optional(), }), }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Light and Dark Mode in AstroPaper Theme DESCRIPTION: Configuration in src/config.ts showing how to enable or disable light and dark mode toggling by setting the lightAndDarkMode property in the SITE object. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/customizing-astropaper-theme-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // file: src/config.ts export const SITE = { website: "https://astro-paper.pages.dev/", author: "Sat Naing", desc: "A minimal, responsive and SEO-friendly Astro blog theme.", title: "AstroPaper", ogImage: "astropaper-og.jpg", lightAndDarkMode: true, // true by default postPerPage: 3, }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Layout Props Interface for Nullable modDatetime in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript code snippet updates the Props interface in the Layout component to allow the modDatetime field to be null. It adds the | null type to the modDatetime property. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/setting-dates-via-git-hooks.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` export interface Props { title?: string; author?: string; description?: string; ogImage?: string; canonicalURL?: string; pubDatetime?: Date; modDatetime?: Date | null; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Primary Color Scheme in AstroPaper Theme DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code in toggle-theme.js that allows setting a primary color scheme when light and dark mode toggling is disabled, with options for light, dark, or system preference. SOURCE: https://github.com/satnaing/astro-paper.git/blob/main/src/data/blog/customizing-astropaper-theme-color-schemes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` /* file: public/toggle-theme.js */ const primaryColorScheme = ""; // "light" | "dark" // Get theme data from local storage const currentTheme = localStorage.getItem("theme"); // other codes etc... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Image Component in Astro Header DESCRIPTION: Code for importing Astro's Image component and a PNG logo into the Header.astro component.
